decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with big creatures like Griselbrand, Borborygmos Enraged, and Worldspine Wurm using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion. You then use Goryo's Vengeance or Through the Breach to cheat these creatures into play, allowing you to quickly overpower your opponent with their powerful abilities. The deck also includes cards like Nourishing Shoal and Simian Spirit Guide to help ramp up your mana and gain life, creating a powerful and explosive combo strategy.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while burning them with efficient and direct damage spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent by continually playing threats and dealing damage, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its low curve and maximize its potential for explosive turns.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal, counterspells, and card advantage while using Nahiri, the Harbinger to search for win conditions like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own game plan through a mix of versatile spells, such as Lightning Bolt, Path to Exile, and Mana Leak. The deck also includes interaction with Anger of the Gods and Lightning Helix for additional removal and life gain. With a strong mana base and card selection, the deck looks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a slower-paced game.

The deck focuses on aggressive play utilizing cards with high power and toughness ratios to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes efficient removal spells and creature search cards to maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure a consistent flow of colored mana for casting spells. The synergy between creatures with effects like exalted and landfall abilities, along with the ability to generate additional creature spells from the top of the library, allows for explosive turns that can end the game swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize creatures with different abilities to create powerful combos and synergies. By using cards like Viscera Seer, Melira, and Anafenza, players can quickly assemble game-winning combinations while also having access to utility creatures like Qasali Pridemage and Spellskite. Chord of Calling and Collected Company are essential for tutoring and bringing out the necessary pieces for the combo. The mana base is designed to support the various colors needed for the creatures' abilities and to allow for flexibility in casting spells.

The main idea behind this UW Control deck is to slow down the opponent's game plan by countering important spells, removing threats from the board, and controlling the tempo of the game. The deck utilizes a variety of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw to control the board and maintain card advantage. With cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Ancestral Vision, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win the game with efficient threats like Restoration Angel and Celestial Colonnade. Ultimately, the deck's goal is to control the game until it can secure a win condition.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on early game disruption and removal spells, combined with high-value creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Liliana of the Veil while using efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to deal with threats. The efficient mana base allows for consistent casting of powerful spells, while cards like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Scavenging Ooze provide additional value and resilience against various strategies.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of powerful planeswalkers and disruptive cards. The main objective is to slow down opponents' strategies and maintain board control. Cards like Anger of the Gods and Ensnaring Bridge are used to prevent opponents from building a threatening board presence, while Chalice of the Void disrupts their spell casting. Nahiri, the Harbinger and Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide versatile removal and card advantage. The deck also uses Blood Moon to disrupt opponents' mana bases. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption and powerful planeswalkers.

The main concept of this Ad Nauseam combo deck is to quickly draw through the deck using cards like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand, while generating mana with Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism. Once the deck is sufficiently thinned out, the player can use Ad Nauseam to draw their entire deck, then win the game either by casting Laboratory Maniac or Lightning Storm. The deck also includes cards like Angel's Grace and Phyrexian Unlife to prevent the player from losing the game while executing the combo.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of artifact creatures and boosting their power with equipment like Cranial Plating, while using cards like Etched Champion and Hangarback Walker for protection. Signal Pest and Steel Overseer help boost the team's power, while Galvanic Blast offers removal and reach. The mana base is optimized for efficiency, with lands like Inkmoth Nexus and Blinkmoth Nexus providing additional threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive strategy that leverages the synergy between artifacts and creatures.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures like Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Wild Nacatl, while using burn spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Boros Charm to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent from the very beginning and utilizing direct damage spells to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. This deck aims to win the game as fast as possible through aggressive creature attacks and direct damage spells.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to use efficient removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption to control the game and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on tempo plays with cards like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler, while also utilizing powerful spells like Kolaghan's Command and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats. The deck aims to stabilize the board and out-value the opponent through card advantage generated by Snapcaster Mage and card draw spells like Serum Visions. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

This Jund deck focuses on efficient removal, disruption, and powerful threats to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize with removal like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to deal damage. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and control, while cards like Huntmaster of the Fells and Raging Ravine offer additional threats and versatility to outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on chaining spells and extra turn effects to create a controlling and disruptive strategy. By utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Cryptic Command, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan while setting up for combo finishes with cards such as Part the Waterveil and Time Warp. The inclusion of cards like Gigadrowse and Void Snare allows for additional disruption, while cards like Howling Mine and Dictate of Kruphix provide card draw to ensure consistency in executing the game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various powerful spells such as Cryptic Command, Remand, and Lightning Bolt while ramping up mana with cards like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek. The main win condition revolves around casting Scapeshift to search for and put into play multiple copies of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, along with Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in one turn. Bring to Light acts as a versatile tutor, allowing the player to search for any key spell needed in a given situation.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-based strategy. By playing efficient early creatures like Goblin Guide, Kird Ape, and Wild Nacatl, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Atarka's Command, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The deck also includes cards like Reckless Bushwhacker to provide a powerful finisher, while cards like Tarmogoyf and Path to Exile offer additional versatility and removal options. The mana base is designed for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to deploy threats quickly and efficiently.
